fields.descriptive_line:
[663:1-1876] An oval flat tablet off-white semi-opaque carnelian, engraved in bold letters in the centre with: 

 الله اکبر

God is great

The Central oval distinguished by engraved cross-hatching around the ‘voided’ inscription. The centre is framed within two concentric bands. The first band engraved with Surat Al-'Ikhlāş:

بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَد اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ



The outer border is engraved with Surat Al-Fātiĥah:

بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ مَالِكِ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ إِيَّاكَ نَعْبُدُ وَإِيَّاكَ نَسْتَعِينُ اهدِنَا الصِّرَاطَ الْمُسْتَقِيمَ صِرَاطَ الَّذِينَ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ غَيْرِ الْمَغْضُوبِ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلاَ الضَّالِّينَ 



The verso is heavily chipped. 


[663:3-1876] An oval flat tablet of semi-opaque, light yellow carnelian; engraved with two different texts in concentric bands. The centre is inscribed with (21:87):

لا اله الا انت سبحانك
اني كنت من الظالمين

None has the right to be worshipped but You (O Allah), Glorified (and Exalted) are You (above all that (evil) they associate with You). Truly, I have been of the wrong-doers.

The outer band is inscribed with Surat Al-'Ikhlāş (113:1-5), set within narrow double border:

بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم. قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ. مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ. وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ. وَمِن شَرِّ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ. وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ

The verso is marked with ‘J an’

[663:4-1876] An oval tablet of brown cornelian, engraved in the centre with:

یا رفیع الدرجات

O' you of  high degrees


[663:5-1876] An oval tablet of semi-opaque, light yellow carnelian, the centre engraved with Surat Al-'Ikhlāş:

بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَد اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَد وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ

Chips on the verso edge suggest it was removed from a frame. 


[663:6-1876] An oval tablet of medium brown carnelian, engraved in a more utilitarian hand. The centre with:

بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ

In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful

The border is engraved with Sūrat al-Kāfirūn:

بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْكَافِرُونَ * لَا أَعْبُدُ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ * وَلَا أَنْتُمْ عَابِدُونَ مَا أَعْبُدُ * وَلَا أَنَا عَابِدٌ مَا عَبَدْتُمْ * وَلَا أَنْتُمْ عَابِدُونَ مَا أَعْبُدُ * لَكُمْ دِينُكُمْ وَلِيَ دِينِ

[663:7-1876] An oval tablet of variegated off-white and pale yellow semi-opaque agate. The stone is engraved in the centre with an outline, reading in a large and bold script:

یا محمد

O'  Mohammad

The letters of the word are further engraved with Surat Al-'Ikhlāş:

بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَد اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَد وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ

[663:8-1876] A long, oval tablet of semi transparent off white carnelian, engraved in the centre with: 

بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ

In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful

The borders are engraved with Van Yakad:

وإِن یَکادُ الّذینَ کَفَروا لَیُزلِقونَکَ بِأَبصارِهِم لَمّا سَمِعُوا الذِّکرَ و یَقولونَ إِنَّهُ لَمَجنونٌ و مَا هُوَ إِلاّ ذِکرٌ لِلعالَمین

[663:9-1876] 
A flat, semi transparent, off white tablet of carnelian, of oval shape, engraved in a strong and elegant hand with Surat Al-'Ikhlāş:

بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَد اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَد وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ

The script is delicately embellished with vowels and decorative dot motifs, set within a delicate border of two concentric lines. 



Traces of black ink present. 

[663:10-1876] A flat oval tablet of off-white, semi opaque carnelian, elegantly engraved with:

لآ اله الا الله  محمد  بنی الله علی ولی الله

(There is no god but Allah, Mohammad is the prophet of Allah, Ali is the ‘deputy’ / leader of Allah)

A very Shia inscription, professing the primacy of Ali’s claim to the caliphate over the claim of Omar, Osman and Aby Bakr. 

 
The script is vocalised and decorated with dotted motifs. The design is set within two fine concentric lines. 

[663:13-1876] 
A light yellow carnelian of oval shape, engraved in nasta‘liq calligraphy with Surat al-Nas:

بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم. قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ. مَلِكِ النَّاسِ. إِلَهِ النَّاسِ. مِن شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ. الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ النَّاسِ. مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ

[663:14-1876] Al light yellow carnelian seal of oval shape. Engraved in nasta‘liq calligraphy with Surat Al-Falaq: 

بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَق مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ وَمِنْ شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ  وَمِنْ شَرِّ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ وَمِنْ شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَد

[663:16-1876] A circular tablet of black (basalt?); stone; engraved; inscription framed within a double border


[663:24-1876] A circular tablet of white opaque jade / carnelian? Decorated at the top with a (Chinese?) knot motif, engraved with: 

محمد علی هو

Mohammad, Ali, Ho

Traces of ink present. 

Negative

[663:25-1876] 
A rectangular, thin, flat tablet of variegated light brown carnelian, delicately inscribed in a silver / white pen, with the name of ‘panj tan’ (five people: the five people of the house of the prophet in Shiasm):

ا لله محمد علی فاطمه حسن حسین

Allah, Mohammad, Ali, Fatemeh, Hassan, Hossein

Set within a border of triple dot design in shape of triangles.
fields.physical_description:
[663:1-1876] An oviate tablet of off-white, semi-opaque carnelian, engraved in bold letters in three concentric oval registers: the centre with 'Allah O Akbar' (God is Greater) in reserve against a coss-hatched ground. The middle register with 'The Unity' (Koran 112, 1-4). The outer register with 'The Opening' (Koran I, 1-7).
[663:2-1876] An oviate tablet of semi-transparent, off-white agate, engraved with two different texts in concentric bands: the centre with 'The Prophets' (Koran 21-the 2nd half of 87). The outer border engraved with 'The Unity' (Koran 112, 1-4) within narrow double borders, the vowel marks and spot motifs applied delicately.
[663:3-1876] An oviate flat tablet of semi-opaque light yellow cornelian, the centre engraved with 'The Prophets' (Koran, 21, 2nd half of 87). The outer border engraved with 'The Daybrak' (Koran, 113, 1-5).


[663:4-1876] An oval tablet of brown cornelian, engraved in the centre with 'Ya Rafi' ud Darajaat' (O' you of high degrees); and 'The Nad e Ali' in the outer border.
[663:5-1876] An oval tablet of semi-opaque, light yellow cornelian, the centre engraved with 'Ya Allah' (O' Lord), and the outer band engraved with 'The Unity' (Koran 112, 1-4) within a narrow double border.
[663:6-1876] An oval tablet of medium brown carnelian, engraved in a utilitarian hand with 'In the Name of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful' in Arabic in the centre; and the rest of 'The Disbelievers' (Koran 109, 1-6) in the outer band.
[663:7-1876] An oviate tablet of variagated off-white and pale yellow semi-opaque agate, engraved with an elaborate design of a 'Ya Mohammad' (O' Mohammad) in reserve against a cross-hatched ground, the letters in-filled with 'The Unity' (Koran 112, 1-4). The remaining space with floral sparys and vowel marks.
[663:8-1876] A long, oval tablet of semi-transparent off-white cornelian, engraved in the centre with 'In the Name of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful' in large letters in reserve against a cross-hatched ground in Arabic; and the rest of '      ' (Koran,                 ) in the border.
[663:9-1876] A flat, semi transparent, off-white tablet of cornelian of oval shape, engraved in a strong and elegant hand with 'The Unity' (Koran 112, 1-4). The script is delicately embellished with vowel marks and spot motifs within a very delicate border of two concentric ovals.
[663:10-1876] A flat oval tablet of off-white, semi-opaque carnelian, elegantly engraved with 'The Shia Kalemeh Shahada' (There is no god but Allah, Mohammad is the prophet of Allah, Ali is the deputy of Allah) within a narrow double band. The script is embelllished with vowel markings and spot motifs.The stylised 2nd 'M' of Mohammad is stretched to form a horizontal ruling for the three lines of calligraphy.
[663:11-1876] A narrow, rectangular tablet seal of light red-brown cornelian, the greater face engraved in reverse with:
ابو الحسن بن احمد
/  احمدن

[663:12-1876] An oval tablet of dark brown-red carnelian, engraved in fine nasta'liq calligraphy and tooled decoration with '                      '.
[663:13-1876] A light yellow carnelian of oval shape, engraved in Nasta'liq calligraphy with 'The Mankind' (final Sura, Koran 114, 1-6) within a decorative border.
[663:14-1876] A light yellow carnelian of oval shape, engraved in Nasta'liq calligraphy with 'The Daybreak' (Koran 113, 1-5) with decorative tooling within a decorative border, very similar to 663:13-1876.
[663:24-1876] A circular tablet of opaque white jade (? carnelian), the greater face engraved with the words Mohammad Ali in the centre, the top with a shape reminiscing of a chinese knot, and the base with 'Hoo' in Arabic in reverse.
[663:25-1876] A rectangular and thin, flat tablet of variagated light brown carnelian delicately inscribed in a silver-white pen with the names of 'The Five People' (Allah, Mohammad, Ali, Fatimah, Hassan, and Hossein). The outer border is tooled with small dots in the form of triangles. The reverse is irregular in shape.
[663:26-1876] A cornelian flat oval of medium brown, the tapered side engraved with a 'primitive' design of a hooded warrior in profile holding sticks/spears in the forefront. To the left of the figure  a spool-shaped tabernacle, to the right a vertical tri-sectioned line, possibly a tree.
[663:27-1876] A hexagonal, table-cut amethyst with a deep culet, the table surface engraved schematically with a lion in a 'primitive' style.
